name: Phaser
description: This algorithm is based on the Phaser algorithm from the disting mk4. It’s a classic phaser effect using a number of all-pass filters to introduce notches into the audio’s frequency spectrum. You may like to apply an LFO to the sweep CV input.

parameters.name: Sweep
parameters.description: Sweeps the all-pass filters over the audio spectrum.

parameters.name: Feedback
parameters.description:
Sets the amount of feedback around the effect.
Negative values invert the signal.

parameters.name: Warp
parameters.description:
If enabled, warps the sweep parameter/CV for a
more perceptually linear sweep.

parameters.name: Input scale
parameters.description: Sets the scaling of the sweep CV input.

parameters.name: Level
parameters.description: The output gain applied to the effected signal.

parameters.name: Width
parameters.description:
The number of busses to process, starting from the
Input. For example, for a stereo signal, set this to 2.

parameters.name: Output mode
parameters.description:
The standard Add/Replace mode selector as
described above.

input_ports.name: Input
input_ports.description: The first audio input bus, with additional busses processed based on the Width parameter.

input_ports.name: Sweep input
input_ports.description: The bus to use for the sweep CV.

output_ports.name: Output
output_ports.description: The first output bus for the effected signal, following the Output mode selector (Add/Replace).
